title: What was the first ever mobile phone equipped with a camera? - Quora

response.answer_text: Arguably, the first mobile phone equipped with a camera was a 1997 Motorola Startac that Phillipe Kahn equipped with a camera--Meet the Man Behind the Very First Camera Phone--however this wasn't a commercially available phone. The Samsung SCH-V200 released in June 2000 had a built in camera, but the camera was separate from the phone's network access, so you had to connect it to a computer to get to the photos.  The first cameraphone where the camera could send pictures across the cellular network was the Sharp J-SH04 released in November 2000 (marketed as J-Phone). http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/1550622.stm

The earliest patent, was in 1997, for a cellular phone with a built in camera, is here US RE44,103 , you can find in on Google patents. This patent is now owned by Apple, inventors Lyndsay Williams, Peter Cochrane of BT Labs, Ipswich UK. This mobile phone invention also was the first to use sensors such as accelerometers, and heat tracking for the face.
